author: Nino-kun
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->
Path auto-completion doesn't work for non build-in commands if path contain square brackets symbols.

## Steps to reproduce

```
New-Item -Type File -Name '[test].txt'
Copy-Item '``[ + <TAB> work and became Copy-Item '.\`[test`].txt'
notepad  '``[ + <TAB> doesn't work
```

## Expected behavior

```
TAB-key auto-complete path for any command.
```

## Actual behavior

```
Path auto-completion doesn't work if command not pwsh build-in.
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```
PSVersion                      7.0.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19042
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: hv0905
comments.body:
The issue still exists after nearly 2 years... I hope it can be fixed.
Even worse, the built-in command also can't work with the autocomplete in this case.

# Repro

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29349119/181788450-83ecf8a0-a6bf-4dae-8252-fac3ac0a419c.png)
In this case, I can't perform an autocomplete.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29349119/181788604-74ac8166-4d3f-42ec-b346-e2be3a9d76d2.png)
Neither this.

comments.author: Nino-kun
comments.body:
Powershell is really non-intuitive in that part.
Autocompletion work most of the time, but some time it request adding special characters, and some time it doesn't work at all.
Your examples won't work because of one backtick character <`>. If you write two backticks, it will.

**cat '.\\\`[ + \<TAB\>** - don't work
**cat '.\\\`\`[ + \<TAB\>** - work
**cat .\\\`\`[ + \<TAB\>** - don't work again, because  single quote symbol missing.

title: Auto-completion doesn't work for non build-in commands and path with []
